meanings.definition: A rotating body that maintains its orientation in space
meanings.sent1: The gyrostat on the spaceship kept it facing the stars at all times.
meanings.sent2: The gyroscope is a type of gyrostat that helps with navigation.
meanings.sent3: The gyrostat at the amusement park made sure the spinning ride didn't make anyone dizzy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a gyrostat, always staying focused on her goals.
meanings.sent5: The gyrostat's ability to stay steady in motion fascinated the students in physics class.

meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure angular velocity
meanings.sent1: The scientist used the gyrostat to calculate the speed of the spinning top.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to calibrate the gyrostat before taking any measurements.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat batted at the gyrostat, thinking it was a new toy.
meanings.sent4: His eyes followed the gyrostat's spinning motion like a hawk tracking its prey.
meanings.sent5: The gyrostat's precise readings helped the engineers design a more efficient engine.

meanings.definition: A device used to stabilize a moving object
meanings.sent1: The gyrostat attached to the drone kept it steady even in strong winds.
meanings.sent2: Pilots rely on gyrostats to prevent their aircraft from rolling uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The chef used a gyrostat to keep the soup from spilling as he moved quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence acted like a gyrostat, stabilizing the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The gyrostat's technology revolutionized the way ships stayed balanced at sea.
